turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Oxygen (Avalon album).
turn.2: Oxygen (Avalon album) Oxygen is Avalon's fifth studio album, released on May 22, 2001, and produced by Brown Bannister and Grant Cunningham.
turn.3: Did it have any hit singles?
turn.4: The project was strongly supported by Christian radio, containing six No. 1 radio singles—the most of any Avalon album to date.
turn.5: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.6: " Oxygen" is the first (and so far, only) album by the group to release alongside a Collector's Edition, which features a hidden bonus track, "Beyond the Clouds".
turn.8: "Oxygen" received a warm welcome from Christian radio, as the album now boasts six No. 1 radio hits—the most of any Avalon album to date.
turn.9: What were some of its highlights?
turn.10: Highlights include:   Riding the momentum of its radio successes, "Oxygen" was an out-of-the-box bestseller.
turn.11: How did it do on the charts?
turn.12: It sold more than 33,400 copies its first week of release, debuting at #37 on the "Billboard" 200 and #1 on Billboard's Christian albums chart.
